message.content: Sceloporus tristichus is a species of lizard that belongs to the Phrynosomatidae family. It has a significant distribution range in Western North America. Its body is generally flattened and has a pointed snout. The color of its skin may range from brown to green and grey, with a pattern of dark stripes running across its back. The belly of Sceloporus tristichus is often bright, with a blue or orange hue. The texture of its skin is rough and covered in scales. These lizards are mainly active during the day and can be found in a variety of habitats, from rocky cliffs to deserts and arid grasslands.
